oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Tennessee Union soldier James N. Levi
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Letter from James Noah Levi to Eunice C. "Nicey" Vandergriff Levi, his wife. James N. Levi was born December 18, 1833, in Falling Water, Hamilton County, Tennessee. He walked for 13 nights from Kentucky to join the Federal Army at Walden's Ridge (Signal; Mtn.) and enlisted in Co. I, 2nd Tenn. Inf. Regt., USA. Levi was captured at Rogersville on Nov. 6, 1863 and died of smallpox in Andersonville Prison on June 3, 1864. He is buried in grave no. 12934 at Andersonville National Cemetery in Georgia.
